techmeme.title: Identity verification service provider Socure agrees to acquire Effectiv, which helps businesses manage fraud prevention tools, for $136M in cash and equity (Emily Mason/Bloomberg)
Notion previews Mail, an email client that uses AI to organize, archive, or draft emails and handle scheduling and follow-ups, saying it is "coming soon" (Frederic Lardinois/TechCrunch)
A look at the White House's big bet on Intel; sources: Gina Raimondo urged companies to order Intel's US chips, but most favored TSMC's more advanced techniques (New York Times)
Filing: Microsoft puts an "assessment of investing in bitcoin" as a voting item for its December 10 shareholder meeting; its board recommends voting against it (MK Manoylov/The Block)
In a post, Perplexity criticizes media companies that have sued over AI, saying they wish AI tools didn't exist and prefer that corporations own reported facts (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
